isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000i and 9000i - CUMMINS ISM AND AHD ENGINE SYSTEM - TROUBLESHOOTING - Performing A Diagnostic Check With The Engine Off

svcproc.title: Performing A Diagnostic Check With The Engine Off
svcproc.para: A diagnostic check may be performed using the Diagnostic On/Off switch and Cruise Set/Resume. Any error codes will be flashed through the red Engine Stop Light and yellow Engine Warning Light. If no errors are found, both lights will stay on while the diagnostics switch is on. Consult the Cummins Operation and Maintenance Manual furnished with the vehicle for exact procedures and fault code information.
To determine the fault codes use the following procedure:

step1.para: Begin the procedure with the engine off.
Place the switch key in the off position.
Turn the diagnostic On/Off switch to the on position.
Turn the key switch to run position (not crank).

note.para: Cummins CM570 engine diagnostics must be run with the engine NOT RUNNING.
If BOTH Yellow Engine Warning and Red Engine Stop lights come ON and stay ON, it is an indication that no engine faults are present.

svcproc.para: If BOTH the yellow Engine Warning and red Engine Stop lights come on momentarily and then go out, it is an indication that engine faults are present.
If BOTH the yellow Engine Warning and red Engine Stop lights come on and stay on, it is an indication that no engine faults are present.

step1.para: Yellow Engine Warning light will flash once.
There will be a one to two second pause.
Red Engine Stop will flash code with one or two seconds between digits.
Yellow Engine Warning light will flash indicating the end of that fault code, and then start over and repeat the same fault code.
To go to the second fault code, move the Set/Resume switch to the Inc. position and then release it. The process will then repeat itself as indicated in steps 5 through 8.
To move back to the last or previous fault code, move the Set/Resume switch to the Dec position and then release it. The process will then repeat itself as indicated in steps 5 through 8.
To stop the diagnostics procedure, correct the faults or move the diagnostic On/Off switch to the off, and turn the vehicle key switch to the off position.
